title: Is it normal to be able to fall asleep almost immediately?
self_text: I used to always toss and turn for a long time before falling asleep but now i can just lie down and my eyes close. It's so weird.

title: I’m looking for a list of all the times in history where an American politician has been impeached. Can anyone help me with that?
self_text: I’ve looked everywhere but can’t find a definitive answer.  I know there have been presidents and judges who were impeached, but no one seems to agree on how many people overall or when they were impeached.

title: What is the difference between a tree and a shrub?
self_text: I have been trying to figure out what the difference between a tree and a shrub is but am getting confused by all of the different sources. Can anyone explain it in simple terms?

title: I've been watching a lot of the "How to Survive" series on YouTube and it seems like a lot of their advice is geared towards people who live in urban areas but they also give advice for rural settings.  So how would you survive if you lived somewhere in the middle?
self_text: If someone has a cabin in the woods, would that be enough or do you need to go deeper into the forest?  I'm assuming that there are people out there with cabins who don't have any food or supplies stored at all.

title: What are some things that you don’t know why they exist?
self_text: I was just looking at a bunch of useless stuff on Amazon and wondering why those items were created in the first place, so yeah...

title: Why do people have a favorite color?
self_text: Like, why is it that some people just like blue more than any other color? Is there something about the way their brain is wired? Or did they grow up liking blue and so it stuck with them?

title: Why do people buy the same clothes for a cheap price instead of buying more expensive and durable clothes?
self_text: I don't get why people buy clothes that they know will wear out after a few washes or wears, when they could just save up and buy more expensive ones that will last longer. It seems like it would be cheaper in the long run to buy higher quality clothes.

title: What is the best way to get out of a timeshare?
self_text: I'm thinking about purchasing a timeshare, but my parents are telling me it's a scam and that I'll never be able to sell it if I don't want it anymore. Is there any truth to that?

title: If you were to get rid of all the land on earth, and replace it with water, what would happen?
self_text: I can't think of any way for life to continue.  But I guess that is why they call it hypothetical.

title: Can you get sick from touching a dead animal?
self_text: Or do they have to be alive and moving for them to pass on the disease?

title: Does a person’s age affect their ability to be “hypnotized” by someone?
self_text: I know people are more susceptible at certain ages, but how much does it play into the effect of hypnotism? Or is that just something people make up to explain why some can’t be put under?

title: Why do women wear clothes that show off their breasts?
self_text: I'm confused as to why women would choose to show off their breasts, especially in the summer. It doesn't make them look more attractive. And it seems like they would be uncomfortable and sweaty.  I also don't understand why women are so obsessed with having big breasts. It's not like men really care about them. They just want a nice body.

title: Why does the United States have a different calendar than all other countries?
self_text: This is probably an idiot question, but I was watching some videos about Europe and they were talking about how it's October 10th, 2023 there, but here in the USA it's still September 9th or something like that. It doesn't make any sense to me!

title: Is it possible to use a smartphone’s flashlight in the dark as a way to scare people?
self_text: Or is there something that would prevent it from working for such a purpose? I know you could just use your hands, but if someone doesn't see them coming they might not notice and then you can scare them with the light! (I'm being serious here)

title: Is it okay to use a gift card from a store that went bankrupt?
self_text: I got a $500 dollar gift card for a store that recently filed bankruptcy and is closing all of its locations.   Is it okay to still try to use it or is the money just gone?

title: Is it okay to smoke marijuana after a Covid-19 vaccine?
self_text: I'm getting the Pfizer vaccine on Friday and I was planning to smoke weed that night as a reward, but now I'm wondering if it might interfere with my immune response.

title: Can I get the COVID vaccine if I’m not feeling well?
self_text: Or does that defeat the purpose?

title: Why do some people say "oh yeah?" when they ask a question?
self_text: Like someone asks "Do you like this movie?" and the other person says "Oh yeah?" instead of saying "Yes" or just nodding, why is that?

title: How do you know if a person is lying to you?
self_text: I have a friend that is always telling lies, but they don’t even think they are lying, and when you call them out on it they get mad at you for calling them out on it.  I feel like they just want attention so much. What do you do with someone like that?

title: Can I be sued for making a false accusation?
self_text: Let’s say you make a false accusation against someone that causes them to lose their job or be arrested, can you get sued by the person you made the false accusation against?

title: Why do people hate Reddit?
self_text: I just joined and it’s a pretty cool place.  There are so many subreddits for everything you can think of, and there's always something to read.   I don't get why people say Reddit is full of trolls.  Maybe they just haven't found the right communities yet.

title: Can I still use my debit card if it's expired?
self_text: My bank is saying they can't send me a new one but my account hasn't been closed or anything, and I don't have the money to get it replaced.

title: Is there a limit to how many times you can use an air fryer before it breaks?
self_text: I’ve been using mine everyday for almost 2 years and it still works great. But I’m worried that it might break if I keep using it so much.  Is there a lifespan for these things or am I being paranoid?

title: I'm a student who just started taking an online class, and I'm trying to get some friends in the class so that way I can study with them. Do you guys have any tips on how to make friends?
self_text: Any advice is welcome! :)

title: Why are there so many people who say they hate the US, but will travel to visit it?
self_text: I'm talking about Americans and non-Americans alike.  I have a lot of friends and family who live in Europe and Asia, and they all seem to want to come here on vacation. But when I talk about living here, or even just how things work here, they look at me like I am crazy.  I've heard some Europeans call America "The land of the free" while also saying that it is full of gun violence, racism, bigotry, etc. I don't understand why someone would want to spend their money traveling to a place they hate.

title: Does anyone know what’s up with the new font?
self_text: I don’t understand it at all, there are no spaces between the words and it just looks like a big block of text.

title: I'm not the best at math and don't know where to start learning more so that I can understand how money works. Where should I begin?
self_text: I have a good job, make good money but don't really know what I'm doing with it... I don't think my parents were great with money either so I didn't pick up much from them.  I need help!

title: Do people use the "!" as a form of emphasis in text?
self_text: I’m not sure if that makes sense. Like do people put “!” after something to show they are excited about it or emphasize what they said?  I have seen people type things like “Wow!” and “Great!” but is that just their way of showing enthusiasm for what they are saying, or is there a specific reason why they would put an exclamation point at the end of these words?

title: Does a glass of water at night give you better dreams?
self_text: So I heard that if u drink a glass of water before bed, it gives you more vivid/better dreams and was wondering if its true? Is there any science behind it?

title: Is it a problem if I want to see the world as a non-binary person?
self_text: Okay, so I'm a non-binary person who wants to travel and see the world. I just don't know how to do it in a way that will be safe for me. I'm afraid of being discriminated against or harassed because of my gender identity. I'm also worried about finding accommodations that are inclusive and accepting. What advice would you give to someone in my situation?  I'm looking for practical tips on how to stay safe while traveling, how to find inclusive accommodations, and how to deal with potential discrimination or harassment.  Thank you in advance for your help!

title: Is there an alternative to using a computer/phone to make video calls?
self_text: I wanna be able to call someone and see their face without having to use my phone or computer

title: Why do some people prefer to use a laptop in bed over watching TV?
self_text: I find it much more comfortable and relaxing to watch TV when I’m trying to fall asleep than using my laptop. But I know some people who would rather use their laptop. What’s the difference between them and me?

title: How does the US government help people pay for college?
self_text: I'm not talking about scholarships or loans, just what are all the programs that will help you with tuition if you can't afford it.   Is there a program where the government pays your tuition if you do volunteer work in certain areas?

title: Does your health insurance cover you in other states?
self_text: I'm moving from California to Texas, and my health insurance is through my job here in CA. Will it still cover me once I move to TX?  I'd rather not pay for another plan if I don't have to.

title: How do people deal with getting a bunch of spam emails?
self_text: I get like 20 per day and i can't keep deleting them. It gets annoying lol

title: Is it possible to get a free credit report?
self_text: I'm not sure if its legal or not, but is it possible for me to obtain my credit report without paying?

title: Is it ok to use a little bit of mouthwash for oral hygiene?
self_text: I have been using a tiny amount of mouthwash on my toothbrush with toothpaste and the results are good so far, but is there any downside to doing that?  I'm not sure if it's going to mess up the balance of my gut biome or something like that.

title: Why do they have to say "you can’t go out with that outfit" ?
self_text: I just don't get why people have to point it out when you are already going to go outside anyway and can't turn back time to change outfits.

title: Do you think the Russian invasion of Ukraine will cause WW3?
self_text: I'm just curious what people think because some people are saying that it will and others aren't sure.  I don't know much about politics, so I would like to hear what people who do think.

title: Do I need to go see a doctor if my dog just sneezed and it was clear liquid?
self_text: Or is that normal?

title: Why is it that you can't find a single job posting for someone who has an Associate of Applied Science degree?
self_text: I have an AAS in Computer Programming and have been searching online for jobs, but all the postings want a Bachelor's Degree at minimum. It seems like no one wants to hire anyone with just an AAS. Is there something wrong with having an AAS?

title: Why does the news never talk about the effects of climate change on plants and animals?
self_text: I've been watching a lot of videos from 10-20 years ago, and they all say that the sea level will rise and polar bears are going extinct because of global warming. It's been 20 years now, and I haven't heard anything about it. So what happened to those predictions? Are they still accurate? What effect is climate change having on plants and animals today? Is there any evidence that it's causing extinctions or other problems?

title: Is it okay to eat something that has fallen on the floor if you pick it up quickly?
self_text: I'm a little bit of a clean freak, so I don't like eating anything that falls on the floor, but my mom says it's okay as long as you pick it up quickly and check for any dirt or debris. What do you guys think?

title: Why do people put their phone in airplane mode when they’re just doing a meeting?
self_text: I can see if you’re on a flight but why would someone want to switch it off during a zoom or teams call?  I always keep mine on so I don’t miss anything.

title: Can you get a dog license if your dog has no name?
self_text: Or is it required to have the dogs name on the tag/license?

title: Why does it feel like my skin is "thinning" as I get older?
self_text: Like I can literally see the veins under my skin more than ever before.  I'm not overweight, so it's not that. It just feels like there's less of a layer between my veins and me. Is this normal?

title: Is it better to have a bad day at work or a bad day in the gym?
self_text: I can’t decide which is worse, having a horrible shift at work or a horrible workout. I just feel like you are more in control of your own performance and motivation when you go to the gym so maybe that makes it easier to cope with a bad session. But you don’t really get paid for going to the gym. So that might be what makes it worse.

title: How does a woman know when her husband is cheating on her?
self_text: Does she have to catch him or someone else has to tell her?

title: If I were to move to the US and buy a car, would I be able to use it for Uber or Lyft?
self_text: What are the requirements?

title: How does a person who is blind get to use the internet?
self_text: I know that there are things called screen readers but how do you find what you want to look at on the internet if you can’t see it? Do they have some sort of search engine for the blind or something like that?

title: What’s the difference between a psychiatrist and a psychologist?
self_text: I have been trying to look for an answer but it’s so confusing, they both seem pretty similar in what they do.  I have never seen either of them before.

title: I keep seeing a lot of posts here about people hating their jobs and the economy is so good now, why are there still so many jobs that pay minimum wage?
self_text: Is it because there's just a lot more people who want to work than before? Or is it something else?

title: If you're a professional athlete or have a high-paying job and get injured on the job, how much of your salary do you still receive?
self_text: I know that when people are fired from jobs they get unemployment benefits but what about if someone gets hurt while working? Do they still get paid their full salary? Or just a portion of it? And how long do they keep getting paid for before they run out of benefits?

title: Why do people say "I'm sorry for your loss" when someone dies of old age?
self_text: I mean they had a good long life and probably weren't in pain, so what are you sorry about?  Shouldn't you be happy that they lived such a long life instead?

title: What is the difference between a “good” and “bad” movie?
self_text: I just watched a bad movie, but it was still good. How can that be?

title: Is there such a thing as a cheap and reliable car?
self_text: I'm looking to buy my first car soon, but everything is so expensive these days that it seems like a luxury item.  Are there any cars under $10k in good condition? (I don't care about brand or model, just looking for something that won't break down on me.)

title: Why don't they have a way to filter out all the bots on here?
self_text: I understand it can be hard but there are so many bots that spam or try and scam people for money and its very annoying.  I know you guys already do some things like shadowban them or remove them when they get reported, but is there anything else you could do about it?

title: How do people just go to sleep?
self_text: I can’t seem to find the off switch, and when I finally fall asleep it doesn’t feel like I am asleep. It feels more like a lucid dream or something.  Any tips for finding that off switch?

title: Is the U.S. on track to have its lowest birth rate ever?
self_text: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-birth-rate-falls-again-lowest-level-over-100-years-2024-05-16/

title: Why do the first few notes of the song "Don't Stop Me Now" by Queen sound like they are from a different song?
self_text: I hear it and can't help but think that there is another song in my head. The last time this happened to me was with "Bohemian Rhapsody". I don't know why, but it always happens with Queen songs. Is there something about their music or arrangements that makes them more likely to have similar-sounding melodies as other songs?

title: Does it make sense to be able to buy a car without having a driver’s license?
self_text: I was thinking about buying a car and thought about how much of an inconvenience it is to get a driver’s license these days, so it got me thinking if you can even purchase a vehicle without being licensed.

title: Why do people say that "the pen is mightier than the sword"?
self_text: I'm just curious.

title: Does the government control how much money we make?
self_text: I'm confused on whether or not they can just give us a certain amount of money to live off of if it was possible, and then when you hit that amount you don't get any more money from working for the rest of your life.  I heard about some communist countries where people could only work so many hours per day but never knew if they controlled how much money people made.

title: Is it okay to be in a relationship with someone you don't love?
self_text: I understand that you should only be in a relationship if you love the other person, but sometimes people fall out of love or never really loved the person they are with. Is it okay to stay with them even if you don't love them? Should you break up with them and find someone else who you do love? Or is it better to just stay with the person you are with and try to make things work?

title: Why does it feel so good to let out a big fart after being bloated?
self_text: It's like instant relief and I can breathe again lol.

title: Why do some people prefer to drink water with a straw?
self_text: I don't see the point of it, it just feels like you have to suck more and it takes longer for the water to get in your mouth.  I just feel as though drinking from a cup is quicker and easier. Is there any health benefits or something?

title: How to change the time on a smart watch?
self_text: Hi, I just got my first smartwatch and don't know how to change the time on it. Any tips?

title: Is there such a thing as a "sane" way to deal with a bully?
self_text: Or is it always about being stronger, and more violent than them? I've been bullied a lot throughout my life so I can be very sensitive about the topic. Please give me some advice if you have any.

title: How to know if I'm going crazy?
self_text: Is it possible that the world is changing and you are the only one who doesn't notice? Or is it just a natural part of aging?  I think I used to be more extroverted but now I like being alone. My friends don't understand why I want to stay home so much.  But my therapist says that everyone changes as they get older. Is that true?

title: If I were to live in a country that has no gun laws, what would the most useful thing for me to learn?
self_text: Not necessarily how to use a gun but something that will help me be able to survive a situation where someone is trying to kill me with one.

title: Can you have a cold for weeks?
self_text: I’m pretty sure I’ve had a cold for the past 3-4 weeks, but I’m not going to bother with getting it checked out unless it gets worse.  Is that normal? Does anyone else get colds that last that long?

title: Does it make sense to not sleep because you're tired?
self_text: I have been going through a hard time and haven't slept for more than an hour or two in days, but i feel like when i try to go to bed my body is too exhausted to actually fall asleep. Is that even possible?  I also get the feeling if I just stay awake I can get some things done, but then I am just stuck in a cycle of not sleeping at all. It makes no sense to me why someone would not want to sleep when they are tired...

title: Why are there so many "Billionaire vs Millionaire" videos on YouTube?
self_text: It's always Billionaire vs Millionaire, or Billionaire vs Average Person. There is a lot of content with billionaires, but not as much with millionaires.  Why is that?

title: I was just watching a show and someone said “I have no idea” in response to something that seemed pretty obvious, but then they asked if the other person had “any clue”. Is it appropriate to ask someone if they have any clue after saying you have no idea?
self_text: Or is it too passive aggressive or even condescending?

title: How do you stay motivated to exercise?
self_text: I want to start working out, but after a while it just becomes a chore and I stop doing it. Any tips on how to keep up with the routine?  I'm really struggling to find motivation for anything in my life right now, and I think that's why I can't seem to stick with it.  Maybe I should just try to make it fun instead of trying to treat it like a job?

title: I got a little bit of grease in my eye, what should i do?
self_text: Is there anything I can use to wash it out that isn’t water or eye drops?

title: How much is a lot of money?
self_text: I've always wondered what people mean when they say something like "a lot of money" or "it cost a lot of money".  Is it $10,000? $25,000? $100,000? Is it a percentage of your income? Or does the amount change depending on who you ask?

title: Is it okay to give a gift card that you have already used?
self_text: If I get a gift card for $25 but then end up using $10 of it, is it still ok to give the rest to someone else as a present? Or does that make me look cheap?

title: Why does the number of comments on Reddit always increase by a multiple of two?
self_text: I've noticed that when I click "show more" it increases the amount of comments by 20, or 50, or 100. Is there any reason for this?  It seems kind of odd and doesn't make sense why they wouldn't just increment by 1 to be precise.

title: Why do people with long hair look so hot when they get their hair wet?
self_text: I’m a man and I have short hair, but whenever I see someone with long hair get it wet, it looks really sexy.  I don’t know why!  Maybe it's just me.

title: What's the best way to get rid of a bad smell on a carpet?
self_text: I have an old rug that smells like pee and it's really hard to get rid of the smell.  I tried using baking soda, vinegar, dish soap and water, but nothing seems to work! Any suggestions?

title: Why does it take so long for the US to get new weapons?
self_text: In Ukraine, a weapon that was created last week is being used in combat today. In the US, we're still waiting for something from two years ago.

title: How does the US government make money?
self_text: I know that they get taxes from us, but how do they make more than just that? Do they also sell things to other countries or something?

title: Do you need a prescription for CBD oil?
self_text: I'm trying to figure out what is the best way to get CBD oil and if I need a prescription or not.  I have been researching it online but there are so many different opinions that I don't know who to trust.

title: Why do people get married?
self_text: I am not asking why do they get married, but what is the point of it? Like a wedding party for all your friends and family to show you love each other... What's the point? Seems like a waste of money when you can just go on a date with someone and be happy as hell together. Or if you want to start a family then have kids. Just seems like people are doing it because their parents expect them to.

title: Do you guys feel like it's easier to do the work when someone is watching?
self_text: I noticed that whenever my mom watches me do something, i finish a task much faster and better than if she wasn't there. This happens with chores too (such as doing dishes or cleaning).   Is it just me or does anyone else feel like they get more done whenever someone is supervising them?  I can see how it might be because of distraction but it seems to happen more often in situations where the person isn't actively talking to me while im doing things.

title: Do you think the United States will ever leave NATO?
self_text: If it does, do you think that would be a good or bad thing for both the US and Europe?

title: Is it okay to use a credit card to pay for the taxes I owe?
self_text: If so, which credit cards are best to use?

title: Are the rules for what you can and cannot say on a public forum different in Canada than they are in America?
self_text: I'm not talking about hate speech, just regular things like "I don't agree with that".  Are there different laws or policies around free speech?

title: Does it feel good to be a troll?
self_text: I'm not asking about the people that "troll" on social media and like making people mad for fun. That is definitely wrong and bad. But does it feel good when you have an argument with someone in person, or are debating something and can use your wit/intelligence to come up with a really good point or line of reasoning that makes them speechless? Or maybe even get them to admit they were wrong?  I just had a really satisfying debate with my brother over if we should watch basketball or video games (I wanted video games) but he was being really stubborn about it so I started listing all the ways watching basketball would be worse than playing video games until he finally gave in and said "okay fine let's play video games." It felt pretty good haha. Is this what people who troll online feel when they successfully make someone angry? Because that doesn't seem very satisfying...

title: What is the purpose of having a big butt?
self_text: I know it's for giving birth and such, but what is the actual biological advantage to having a big butt vs a small butt? Is there even an advantage?

title: What's the difference between a car and an automobile?
self_text: Is it just that "automobile" is more formal?

title: Why is the US military so much more expensive than every other countries?
self_text: I see that the US spends way more money on its military, but why? Is it because they have a lot of bases around the world? Or is it something else?

title: Why are some people afraid to go out in the dark?
self_text: I understand that it's dangerous, but what do they think is going to happen? Are they afraid of being kidnapped or mugged? Or something else?

title: Do you ever feel like the world is against you?
self_text: I'm not asking for sympathy, just wondering if anyone else has felt that way before and how they dealt with it.  I know there are people who have had a lot worse things happen to them than me, but sometimes it feels like everything bad happens to me.   Maybe I'm just being dramatic and need to stop focusing on the negative. But still...   Do you ever feel like the world is against you? How do you deal with it?

title: Is there a specific reason why the bottom of shoes/sneakers are so often black?
self_text: It just feels like most shoes/sneakers have black bottoms, even if they're bright colors on top.  Is it for durability or something?

title: Is there any truth to the saying that a penny saved is a penny earned?
self_text: I'm trying to learn how to manage my money and keep hearing this saying from different sources but it doesn't really make sense when you think about it...

title: Why is it that every time I have a bad day, the news is filled with even worse stuff?
self_text: Just feel like whenever I am down in the dumps and turn on the tv, there's always some horrible story going on somewhere else...  Is it just my perception or does this happen to everyone?

title: Is it bad to spend my money on video games?
self_text: I'm looking for a new hobby but can't think of anything and keep going back to the same thing, buying video games.  I have friends that do other things like go out with their friends or play sports. But I don't really have any friends anymore and I haven't done anything physical in years. I just want something I can do by myself to take up time when I'm bored. It doesn't even need to be fun, as long as it takes up some time. Any suggestions?

title: If you are a woman who is not attracted to men, do you ever get asked why?
self_text: I never understand when people ask me why I'm not interested in men or what happened that made me like women instead of men.  It's my preference. Do women who aren't into men deal with the same thing?
